column4: could somebody please explain the difference between the nvidia and nv modules?
figured as much
has anybody had problems getting the nvidia module to load on ubuntu systems?  I dont ever remember haveing much of a problem in deb.
I get no return from modprobe nvidia
the error in the gdm/xorg logs say "failed to initialize the NVIDIA kernel moduel. ><
I'm wondering if letting invidia compile it's own moduel was a good idea.
nvidia*
invidia is awfully close to invidious, and it can be :)
sudo updatedb
gconf-editor, navigate to /etc/nautilus/desktop  or preferences , look for desktop
ty
~/.gconf/apps/metacity (access it with gconf-editor, navigate to apps/metacity)
maybe I wasn't clear enough.  Where are is the setting that determines what window manager is used?
ah, that's shifted around and I've lost track ;(
the ubuntu libgpod doesn't support it. You'd have to compile it
gl apps and compiz simply don't get along well
so I've noticed.
is there anything I can do besides metacity --replace every time I want to run something full screen?
#compiz-fusion probably could explain why, it you're really interested
good idea, i'll go pester them

I just wanted to let you know, in case anybody else asks, the 10 minute period between crashes was significant.  It turns out that the screen saver was the culprit, but only causes problems in compiz.  I don't know why yet, but disabling the screen saver allows me to run full screen GL apps with compiz running without crashes.
try using a screensaver that doesn't use gl
hm. Oh well, I'll keep that one in mind
